pullRequest.body:
Various lemmas about `Polynomial.natDegree`

Co-authored-by: Pratyush Mishra

---

nodes.body: oops didnt see the wip label sorry ;)

I think that adding some API around `divX` will help here.  For instance, this is an alternative proof of `natDegree_divX_eq_natDegree_tsub_one` that uses neither `Nontriviality` nor `NoZeroDivisors`:
```lean
import Mathlib.Data.Polynomial.EraseLead
import Mathlib.Data.Polynomial.Inductions

open Polynomial

-- no NoZeroDivisors assumption
variable {R : Type u} [Semiring R] {p : R[X]} {a : R}

namespace Polynomial

@[simp]
theorem divX_zero : divX (0 : R[X]) = 0 := leadingCoeff_eq_zero.mp rfl

@[simp]
theorem divX_one : divX (1 : R[X]) = 0 := by
  ext
  simpa only [coeff_divX, coeff_zero] using coeff_one (_ + 1)

theorem divX_C_mul : divX (C a * p) = C a * divX p := by
  ext
  simp

theorem divX_X_pow : divX (X ^ n : R[X]) = if (n = 0) then 0 else X ^ (n - 1) := by
  cases n
  · simp
  · ext n
    simp [coeff_X_pow]

noncomputable
def divX_hom : R[X] →+ R[X] :=
{ toFun := divX
  map_zero' := divX_zero
  map_add' := fun _ _ => divX_add }

@[simp] theorem divX_hom_toFun : divX_hom p = divX p := rfl

theorem natDegree_divX_eq_natDegree_tsub_one : p.divX.natDegree = p.natDegree - 1 := by
  apply map_natDegree_eq_sub (φ := divX_hom)
  · intro f
    simpa [divX_hom, divX_eq_zero_iff] using eq_C_of_natDegree_eq_zero
  · intros n c c0
    rw [← C_mul_X_pow_eq_monomial, divX_hom_toFun, divX_C_mul, divX_X_pow]
    split_ifs with n0
    · simp [n0]
    · exact natDegree_C_mul_X_pow (n - 1) c c0

theorem natDegree_divX_le : p.divX.natDegree ≤ p.natDegree :=
(natDegree_divX_eq_natDegree_tsub_one).trans_le (Nat.pred_le _)
```

If you do decide to go down this road, then adding also 
```lean
theorem divX_C_mul_X_pow : divX (C a * X ^ n) = if n = 0 then 0 else C a * X ^ (n - 1) := by
  simp only [divX_C_mul, divX_X_pow, mul_ite, mul_zero]
```
would likely be expected!  :smile:

@adomani Do you have any opinion on whether `divX` should exist at all? All these lemmas seem great but I feel like I might want them for `p /ₘ X` as well, so why even have this function?

Edit: nvm seems that divX has the advantage of working for semirings.

bors d+

Please apply the suggestions and then feel free to merge

bors d+

```suggestion
theorem eq_C_one_of_monic_natDegree_zero (hf : p.Monic) (hfd : p.natDegree = 0) : p = C 1 := by
```
perhaps? I'm not 100% sure of the naming convention but it seems strange that you have two different styles next to each other

```suggestion
  rw [X_dvd_iff, coeff_sub, coeff_C]
```
or even just put it in one big simp

```suggestion
  by_contra' H
  refine hfne (eq_C_one_of_monic_natDegree_zero hf ?_)
  exact Nat.le_zero.mp H
```
This also works.

```suggestion
  apply natDegree_lt_natDegree
  · apply divX_eq_zero_iff.not.mpr
    rwa [eq_C_coeff_zero_iff_natDegree_eq_zero, ← Ne.def, ← Nat.pos_iff_ne_zero]
  · exact degree_divX_lt (ne_zero_of_natDegree_gt hpd)
```
Slightly shorter.

```suggestion
theorem coeff_zero_eq_iff {a : R} : p.coeff 0 = a ↔ ∃ g : Polynomial R, p = X * g + C a := by
  conv_rhs => rw [← X_mul_divX_add p]
  exact ⟨fun h => ⟨p.divX, by congr⟩, fun ⟨g, h⟩ => by simpa using congr_arg (coeff · 0) h⟩
```
This is a shorter version, but I wonder if you really need this lemma.

```suggestion
theorem natDegree_pos_of_monic_ne_one (hf : p.Monic) (hfne : p ≠ 1) : p.natDegree ≠ 0 := by
```
I think that it is common to assume a formally weaker hypothesis and deduce the formally stronger one.  `Nat` has an extensive API, so maybe this is not too important here.

Shouldn't this be `p = 1`?
```suggestion
theorem eq_one_of_monic_natDegree_zero (hf : p.Monic) (hfd : p.natDegree = 0) : p = 1 := by
```
Good point

Unless there is a _very_ common situation where we want this lemma, I don't think this is worth having since it's just the contrapositive of `eq_one_of_monic_natDegree_zero`.
```suggestion
```
(FWIW, if we were to keep it my preferred proof would be `not_imp_not.mpr (eq_one_of_monic_natDegree_zero hf) hfne`)

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem X_mul_divX_add (p : R[X]) : X * divX p + C (p.coeff 0) = p :=
```
You can also add `simp` to `divX_mul_X_add` above. Of course neither will fire very often but there's not harm having them.

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem divX_C_mul : divX (C a * p) = C a * divX p := by
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: expand API for `Polynomial.divX` and some related results
